For the pKa prediction we followed
column3: the method described in Muckerman JT
column6: Wasada-Tsutsui Y. Toward the accurate calculation of pKa values in water and acetonitrile. Biochim Biophys Acta. 2013

column1: We calculated the pKa for a representative dataset of 38 compounds with known experimental pKa values spanning from -3.00 and 17.10.

The experimental values compared with the energy corresponding to the difference between the experimental and computed pKa values were plotted for two separate groups containing neutral to negative and positive to neutral transformations. Linear fitting of these values (R2=0.98273 and 0.97468
column2: respectively) using Microsoft Excel provided the correction to be applied to the SAMPL6 pKa calculations.
the microscopic pKa values reported here are the computed pKa values corrected with the corresponding coefficient
column4: in order to remove the systematic error.

column1: A number of Gaussian09 calculations could not converge using the D.01 version
column2: but converged without problems using the A.02 version.
